alert.note: Alert for Delaware (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 5:42AM EST until December 19 at 8:12PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Binghamton NY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New York... West Branch Delaware At Walton affecting Delaware County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...West Branch Delaware at Walton. * WHEN...From this afternoon to tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Fairgrounds begin to flood at 10 feet. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 AM EST Monday the stage was 8.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 10.9 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 545 PM EST.
